snippet: Significant details of the eventual retreat also remain the subjects of unresolved debates, according to public statements by Fed officials and interviews with some of them.
abstract: Federal Reserve officials are reportedly in no hurry to retreat from their bond-buying campaign to stimulate the economy and are likely to postpone any cuts to the program until 2014; significant details of the eventual retreat also remain the subjects of unresolved debates.
lead_paragraph: Significant details of the eventual retreat also remain the subjects of unresolved debates, according to public statements by Fed officials and interviews with some of them.

headline.main: Fed’s Plan to Taper Stimulus Effort Is Not Expected Until Next Year
headline.print_headline: Fed Is Likely To Keep Foot On the Gas A Bit Longer
